page.title: 04FUNTLEY VILLAGE,N.FAREHAM
page.content: Funtley village,population 500,lies to the N.W. of Fareham.It is a rural community with a combined corner shop and post office,a pub and a working men's club.The village school was closed in 1984 and now lies empty. Most of the houses in the village date from the 19th century but recently a large housing estate has been built on what was derelict land surrounding the old brick works.Although the village lacks amenities it is close enough to Fareham for this to be of no concern to villagers.The village is linear in shape and is surrounded by fields of grass and barley,to the north and is bounded by the M27 to the south.
